title: Curry Stand Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce Recipe
description: This tikka masala sauce is bright orange and richly flavored with onion, garlic, spices, tomato sauce, and cream, cooked with tender chicken chunks.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Asian Indian Main Dishes Chicken Curry Stand Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce 4.9 (2,389) 1,708 Reviews 380 Photos A tikka masala sauce from a classic curry-stand recipe. This is not haute cuisine; it's the kind of nuclear-orange tikka masala you crave when you stumble out of a pub at 2 a.m. I make vast quantities of this sauce at one time as it freezes well. I also use more cayenne pepper than 1 teaspoon, but I give out the recipe like this for people who don't like heat. Submitted by Chris Bellers Updated on April 5, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 380 380 380 380 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) 1 onion, finely chopped 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 tablespoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste (Optional) 1 teaspoon ground ginger 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon ¼ teaspoon ground turmeric 1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce 1 cup heavy whipping cream 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste (Optional) 2 teaspoons paprika 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces ½ teaspoon curry powder Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat ghee in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in garlic; cook and stir just until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, ginger, cayenne pepper, cinnamon, and turmeric into onion mixture; fry until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir tomato sauce into onion and spice mixture; bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Simmer sauce for 10 minutes, then mix in cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, and paprika. Bring sauce back to a simmer and cook, stirring often, until sauce is thickened, 10 to 15 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat vegetable oil in a separate skillet over medium heat. Stir chicken into hot oil; add curry powder. Sear chicken until lightly browned but still pink inside, about 3 minutes; stir often. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Transfer chicken and any pan juices into sauce. Simmer chicken in sauce until no longer pink, about 30 minutes; adjust sugar and salt to taste. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 4,695 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 328 Calories 23g Fat 13g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 328 % Daily Value * Total Fat 23g 30% Saturated Fat 13g 64% Cholesterol 106mg 35% Sodium 981mg 43% Total Carbohydrate 13g 5% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 7g Protein 18g 36% Vitamin C 9mg 10% Calcium 68mg 5% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 462mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Curry Stand Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce 01 of 380 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 380 Photo by  CoolWheat8411 01/02/2025 A keeper! Worth the effort Great flavors I have never in my life made chicken tikka masala despite loving it so much, until today!! It’s a new year so I’m deciding on cooking more and I’m so happy I gave it a go!I used coconut milk instead of heavy cream (A MUST!!!), added tri-colored bell peppers, and a Serrano pepper. Other than that, I followed it exactly written! ITS THE BEST DISH I’VE EVER HAD THE PLEASURE OF EATING! So impressed!! 03 of 380 Photo by  MerryBun8729 07/14/2024 A keeper! Family favorite Crowd-pleaser Great flavors Worth the effort It freezes really nicely without the chicken. I currently did the recipe x14 for meal prep. 04 of 380 Photo by  LisaAnn Eichenblatt 05/28/2024 Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Great flavors A keeper! 10 ⭐️ 05 of 380 Photo by  Steve Junion 03/23/2024 Crowd-pleaser I’ve made this recipe a number of times over the years. It seems to get better every time I make it, and, like many people, I double the sauce. Other good recommendations include adding Masala, I add a couple of tablespoons. The only thing I do differently is to dust my chicken with extra curry seasoning because I love that flavor. The batch that I just made taste amazing, and I can’t wait to try it when it’s fully finished. Many times I like to top it with cilantro as well. Thanks to all of those who have made suggestions over the years. 06 of 380 Photo by  zmahan 03/27/2023 Maui doesn't have indian food restaurant or take out so I have to try to make it on my own. This recipe is so easy. Love it! Make it exact by the as is just little less cayenne pepper. Kids don't like too spicy but that is personal preference. Sometimes I add few chicken thighs as they add more flavor to the result. Once I finish sauce per recipe I put it in the crockpot with chicken (completed on stove per recipe) and let cook. That way dinner is done whenever I want and even more tender and flavors come together! Thank you for this amazing recipe. I am making Naan bread which I will review as well! Also, personal note: to make it easier on myself when I make it I usually pre-make packages of seasoning mixes for this recipe to save time as the measuring and preparation tends to take me the most time. This way I can have 3-4 ready to go packets and quickly put together this easy dinner. 07 of 380 Photo by  Cristian Lagarini Miret 02/17/2023 Thank you so much for sharing this recipe. I made it yesterday, it is not the first time I prepare this dish. I don't add cayenne pepper but I leave it at the table for those that desire a spicy dish. I love it and so does the entire family. 08 of 380 Photo by  Bee Johnson 09/25/2022 This was amazing. I pretty much followed the recipe..I made a few changes just based on what I had on hand.Changes:1 tbsp of onion powder instead of onion2 teaspoons minced garlic (from the jar that ves from the grocery store)2 teaspoons minced ginger (also from a jar)About 1.25-1.5 tablespoon of sugar1 lb of chicken breastCoconut oil instead of vegetable oil- cooked the chicken to about 85% done if not more..-Simmered chicken and sauce for 15 to 20 minutes- next time I will cut the cayenne in half so my kids can tolerate the spice level better.Sooooo good! 09 of 380 Photo by  britta1519 07/31/2022 I made this after having an amazing and expensive dish from an Indian restaurant. This turned out fantastic and was exactly what I had been craving! Thank you for the recipe! 10 of 380 Photo by  KLiban 01/30/2022 I have made this numerous times since first finding the recipe. It is so good. I thought it was about time I thanked you.Thank you for sharing!!! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Indian Chicken 65 1 Rating Daren's Chicken 65 1 Rating Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Chef John's Chicken Tikka Masala 604 Ratings Slow Cooker Chicken Tikka Masala 57 Ratings Indian Chicken Tikka Skewers 1 Rating Chef Doug's Chicken Tikka 2 Ratings Instant Pot Keto Chicken Curry Slow-Simmered Chicken Vindaloo Chicken Cauliflower Korma 35 Ratings Indian Chicken Tikka Masala 31 Ratings Instant Pot® Chicken Biryani 8 Ratings Chicken 65 (Quick and Easy Fried Spicy Chicken) 1 Rating Slow Cooker Chicken Curry 8 Ratings Baked Chicken Curry 1 Rating Chicken Tikka 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
